intro: Rhacoma puberula, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves that give it a velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Rhacoma puberula is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found in disturbed soils. It is sometimes considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
